>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.themes.Item.pHkB3pmyCsl3GOyp]{Xenoarchaeologist}

Your notable exposure to ancient and foreign writing systems allows you to gain the general meaning of new languages with ease, even if you have never been exposed to the language previously. You can attempt a @Check[type:culture] to @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.LeZmnFwnlB89ovBB#decipher-writing]{decipher writing} of up to 250 words of text as a move action, and you have no chance of entirely misconstruing its meaning. Additionally, as long as you have any computer equipment (including just a @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.Item.5GM9QlhUd1EB1LjJ]{comm unit}), you are assumed to have the necessary data set to @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.HWJ570MVgFoO5Reb#take-20]{take 20} on Culture checks to decipher writing, which you can do even if you are not trained in the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.IqOCYDKd9NgBwowp]{Computers} skill. It normally takes you 20 minutes to take 20 on text up to 250 words.
